channel.title: Jethoof's Digital Garden on
channel.description: Recent content in Jethoof's Digital Garden on

item.description: Introduction? This is the first time I ever trying serious writing for once and I never really considered myself any sort of writer despite the fact I’ve been creating my own world for Dungeons and Dragons (D&D) since I was in high school and based it on the world I created while I was in elementary school before the internet was around.

item.title: Brainstorm
item.description: Goal Coming up with a character interaction scene for some of my character. that is under 4k words. - I have modified it so there will be three scenes in the actual writing to make it easier perhaps I would change it later on should it gets too wordy.

item.title: CJK + Latex Support (测试)
item.description: Chinese, Japanese, Korean Support 几乎在我们意识到之前，我们已经离开了地面。 우리가 그것을 알기도 전에 우리는 땅을 떠났습니다. 私たちがそれを知るほぼ前に、私たちは地面を離れていました。 Latex Block math works with two dollar signs $$.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get.

item.title: continues on part 2
item.description: Ben wasn’t sure what it was but he pushes to his father that there’s something off about the gold bars, they weren’t exact but he wasn’t sure how to tell them other than his fingertips told him it’s different.

item.title: Custom Domain
item.description: Registrar This step is only applicable if you are using a custom domain! If you are using a <YOUR-USERNAME>.github.io domain, you can skip this step.

item.title: Daily Prompt - 20220401
item.description: Sprinting duration: 5 min Prompts: try to write with the following words. jester glitch prank fanciful Just write! There’s a fanciful way of pulling a prank these days compared to what we did in the past since this is the age of communication and there are so many things we could do with it compared to a court jester would make fun of themselves in front of the king in the king’s court.

item.title: Deploying Quartz to the Web
item.description: GitHub Pages Quartz is designed to be effortless to deploy. If you forked and cloned Quartz directly from the repository, everything should already be good to go!

item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Obsidian I recommend using Obsidian as a way to edit and grow your digital garden.

item.title: Ignoring Notes
item.description: Quartz Ignore Edit ignoreFiles in config.toml to include paths you’d like to exclude from being rendered. 1 2 3 4 5 6 .

item.title: Introduction
item.description: So it begins, my first National November Writer’s Month Camp! But it’s hardly November you might wonder and NaNoWriMo definitely hosts this three times a year: April, July and November.

item.title: Legends
item.description: This is soon to be my growing list of YAML data for who knows why I am setting this up for other than I could potentially use it for sorting things out.

item.title: Magic
item.description: These are some of the questions I ask myself when I’m creating magic for my world. I personally like magic with rules rather than leaving it to be mystical.

item.title: Magic and Fundamentals
item.description: Is there some sort of rules in your world about magic like laws of thermodynamics? A good example is from Full Metal Alchemist; laws of equilibrant exchange.

item.title: Milestone Scene 1
item.description: Ben gains misbelief about note trusting someone? Ben interacts with someone who had their own intention to use ben as a means to benefit them instead and leave him on the side once the goals are achieved, his father comes into let him know that there’s not even a single being to trust, including his family members because everyone’s out for themselves and if he cannot grasp that then he won’t be able to be a good merchant.

item.title: NaNoWriMo
item.description: Currently it’s just one but I plan to do more of these NaNoWriMo going forward. INaNoWriMo April 22

item.title: NaNoWriMo - 10 min prompt
item.description: Prompt #2: Write a scene where one character lies to another. Why do they do it? Does the other character know they’re lying?

item.title: Obsidian Vault Integration
item.description: Setup Obsidian is the preferred way to use Quartz. You can either create a new Obsidian Vault or link one that your already have.

item.title: Preview Changes
item.description: If you’d like to preview what your Quartz site looks like before deploying it to the internet, here’s exactly how to do that!

item.title: Protagonist design - Ben Wiles
item.description: Physical description Personality Ben is observant with keen interest in understanding what the other’s true intentions because he assumes people are not to by trusted.

item.title: Quartz Philosophy
item.description: “[One] who works with the door open gets all kinds of interruptions, but [they] also occasionally gets clues as to what the world is and what might be important.

item.title: Setup
item.description: Making your own Quartz Setting up Quartz requires a basic understanding of git. If you are unfamiliar, this resource is a great place to start!

item.title: Showcase
item.description: Want to see what Quartz can do? Here are some cool community gardens :) Quartz Documentation (this site!) Strengthening Online Social Bonds: Research Garden Jacky Zhao’s Garden Anson Yu’s Garden Shihyu’s PKM Chloe’s Garden SlRvb’s Site Course notes for Information Technology Advanced Theory Brandon Boswell’s Garden Siyang’s Courtyard If you want to see your own on here, submit a Pull Request adding yourself to this file!

item.title: Story Overview
item.description: Ben finally struck some luck with some trades in a remote hamlet and planning to head back to his home town, however he hears a news a war has broken out and now he cannot go back the way he came from.

item.title: Troubleshooting and FAQ
item.description: Still having trouble? Here are a list of common questions and problems people encounter when installing Quartz. While you’re here, join our Discord :)

item.title: Worldbuilding - Magic and Economy
item.description: Just like any resources and tools in our world, it would impact the economics of your world. Would they be rich if they can use magic because they can do more?

item.title: Worldbuilding - Magic and Politics
item.description: And regulation entails organizational effectiveness, a chain of command, and a structure for logistical support. - Sun Tzu

item.title: Worldbuilding - Magic and Religion
item.description: Magic might be perceived as mysticism or different from divine power from deities. Here are some questions to fill in the gaps.

item.title: Worldbuilding Index
item.description: This is where I put things for worldbuilding, rules and stuff. [[worldbuilding/Worldbuilding - Magic]]

item.title: ​Prompt #3: What is your main character’s most embarrassing memory? Has it affected the things they do or the ways they interact with other characters now?
item.description: Ollie and Ben are never in good terms as long as he can remember. his brother was always sick and their father was always concerned for him more than anything.
